intro: Tarenna cinnamomea var. intermedia, commonly known as the intermediate tarenna, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species with ornamental and medicinal value. The plant is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. It typically grows as an understorey shrub in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
